subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] RE: regional accents
msgSnippet: What about the great stories handed down to generations with the oral traditions in every culture. Humans don t need writing to create and relate stories. The
messageBody:
What about the great stories handed down to generations with the oral traditions in every culture. Humans don't need writing to create and relate stories. The Qur'an started as an oral tradition for example. Do I need to go on. Australian aboriginal religion, songs and stories, all oral tradition from the oldest continuous cultures in the world. If humans are confined naked in a dark cell, they will find a way to make art which when written is literature. But it doesn't have to be written to be legitimate.



> I disagree about Literacy. Have another look at English
> itself, Shakespeare or Chaucer for example. Literacy like all art
> never fades, it's what human's do. We can't help but do it.

Eh? What humans do is speak and understand. Literacy, i.e. reading
and writing, isn't automatic at all. Only 10% of the languages spoken
today have a writing system.


--
There are three kinds of people in the world: John Cowan
those who can count, cowan@...
and those who can't.
